title.value: Playing the System: Can Puzzle Players Teach us How to Solve Hard Problems?
title.justification: The title is clearly indicated at the beginning of the document and is consistently referred to as such throughout the paper.
title.quote: Playing the System: Can Puzzle Players Teach us How to Solve Hard Problems?

extractions.description: This research paper investigates how players of the puzzle game Borderlands Science can provide solutions to the multiple sequence alignment problem, an NP-hard problem, and whether their strategies can be mimicked using Behavioral Cloning.

type.justification: The research involves experiments with actual data from Borderlands Science and evaluates human performance and machine learning methods in solving computational problems.
type.quote: This article explores the potential of crowdsourcing human intuition to tackle NP-hard problems... We test these hypotheses and aim to establish the relevance of small, fast-paced puzzles, when previous work in this feld typically

name.justification: The paper revolves around using citizen science efforts through a video game to tackle scientific problems.
name.quote: Citizen science eforts, which aim to involve non-scientists in the solving of scientifc problems, often struggle with fnding enough participants to address large-scale problems.

name.justification: The paper discusses the use of Behavioral Cloning, a type of machine learning, to replicate player strategies.
name.quote: We also show the strategies of the players, although highly heterogeneous, follow a collective logic that can be mimicked with Behavioral Cloning with minimal performance loss.

name.justification: The paper addresses the multiple sequence alignment problem, which is a common problem in bioinformatics.
name.quote: ...we harness the collective wisdom of millions of players to tackle the classical NP-hard problem of multiple sequence alignment, relevant to many areas of biology and medicine.

name.justification: Behavioral Cloning is explicitly mentioned as a method used to mimic player strategies.
name.quote: ...follow a collective logic that can be mimicked with Behavioral Cloning with minimal performance loss...

is_contributed.justification: Behavioral Cloning is not introduced by this paper; it is an existing technique applied in the study.
is_contributed.quote: ...follow a collective logic that can be mimicked with Behavioral Cloning with minimal performance loss...

is_executed.justification: Behavioral Cloning is used in experiments within the paper to mimic player behavior.
is_executed.quote: ...follow a collective logic that can be mimicked with Behavioral Cloning with minimal performance loss...

is_compared.justification: Behavioral Cloning is compared with the players' solutions and other algorithms to see how effectively it can replicate strategies.
is_compared.quote: We can learn and reproduce player strategies using behavioural cloning.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Behavioral Cloning is discussed as part of the core research methodology but isn't tied to a specific referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This part of the work considers whether the decisions of the players are reproducible using behaviour cloning.

name.justification: Mentioned as one of the models used in the experimentation section to predict human strategies.

is_contributed.justification: FCN is a standard model architecture used in various machine learning applications, not introduced by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: ...our FCN model consists of stacked blocks of 2D convolution layers...

is_executed.justification: The FCN is applied to model human strategies as described in the methods section.
is_executed.quote: ...our FCN model consists of stacked blocks of 2D convolution layers...

is_compared.justification: The paper focuses on using FCN among other models but does not specifically compare its performance against other algorithms directly in the results.
is_compared.quote: ...our FCN model consists of stacked blocks of 2D convolution layers...

referenced_paper_title.value: Fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper introduced FCNs; however, the models are used and validated in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: FCNs were originally presented as a solution to the segmentation problem [Long et al. 2015].

name.justification: Transformers are mentioned in the paper as a machine learning model used for mimicking player strategies.
name.quote: Transformers are a state-of-the-art model with self-attention...

is_contributed.justification: Transformers are a well-known architecture and not developed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Transformers are a state-of-the-art model with self-attention...

is_executed.justification: The paper uses Transformers in modeling and experiments to replicate player behaviors.
is_executed.quote: Transformers. Transformers are a state-of-the-art model with self-attention...

is_compared.justification: While Transformers are used, the paper does not specifically focus on comparing their performance against other model types except in broader contexts.
is_compared.quote: Transformers. Transformers are a state-of-the-art model with self-attention...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper introduced the transformers; however, Transformers are used and validated in the study for modeling purposes.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Transformers. Transformers are a state-of-the-art model with self-attention [Vaswani et al. 2017].

name.justification: The dataset is referenced throughout the paper as the primary data source used for analysis.
name.quote: The Borderlands Science game data consists of human gut microbe genome fragments...

referenced_paper_title.justification: Used specifically in this paper to analyze player strategies and not just a referenced data source.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The Borderlands Science game data consists of human gut microbe genome fragments, sequenced by the Microsetta Initiative...

name.justification: The Microsetta Initiative is mentioned as the source of the sequences used in the game puzzles.
name.quote: The Borderlands Science game data consists of human gut microbe genome fragments, sequenced by the Microsetta Initiative...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper mentions this dataset as part of the pre-alignment data provided for the puzzles but does not contribute new data from it.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The puzzles submitted to players are carved out of this pre-alignment.
